articles.title: Border czar Tom Homan says 700 ICE and CBP officers are leaving Minneapolis - The Washington Post
articles.description: The reduction of ICE officers in Minneapolis is a significant scaling back of Homeland Security’s presence and comes after two U.S. citizens were killed.

articles.title: Asian Stocks to Fall as Tech-Led Drop Gains Pace: Markets Wrap - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: A slump in technology stocks snowballed into Asia as mounting anxiety over frothy valuations and massive artificial intelligence spending drove investors to trim exposure.

articles.title: Ryan Preece wins Cook Out Clash at Bowman Gray amid winter weather - NASCAR.com
articles.description: Ryan Preece won the 2026 Cook Out Clash at Bowman Gray Stadium, overcoming winter weather in a Wednesday night feature.

articles.title: Intelligence director Tulsi Gabbard’s office obtained and tested voting machines in Puerto Rico - CNN
articles.description: The Office of Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard obtained voting machines from Puerto Rico and probed them for security vulnerabilities, the office said in a statement to CNN on Wednesday.

articles.title: Texas A&M professor files suit after firing over gender identity lesson - Politico
articles.description: "There’s no satisfaction in doing this, only sadness,” Melissa McCoul said.

articles.title: Tigers, Framber Valdez Agree To Three-Year Deal - MLB Trade Rumors
articles.description: The Tigers make a major splash late in the offseason, signing Framber Valdez to a short-term deal to pair with Tarik Skubal atop the rotation.

articles.title: Most Preventable Cancers Are Linked to Just Two Lifestyle Habits - ScienceAlert
articles.description: It's easy to feel powerless against cancer, but a new study has identified several ways that we can reduce the odds of it occurring.

articles.title: Tom Brady’s Old Teammates Called Him Out for Not Siding With Patriots in Super Bowl - Sports Illustrated
articles.description: Some ex-Patriots called out Tom Brady for refusing to side with New England in Super Bowl LX.

articles.title: Bank of England expected to hold interest rates - BBC

articles.title: E.l.f. Beauty posts earnings beat, raises full-year guidance - CNBC
articles.description: E.l.f. Beauty said its acquisition of Hailey Bieber's skin-care company, Rhode, contributed $128 million to the company's net third-quarter sales growth.

articles.title: After crushing protests, Iran's supreme leader now tries to avert a U.S. attack - PBS
articles.description: The ferocious suppression of the protests is a sign of how deep a threat Khamenei and Iran’s leadership see in the widespread popular anger.

articles.title: Measles Is Causing Brain Swelling in Children in South Carolina - WIRED
articles.description: In the ongoing measles outbreak in South Carolina that has infected more than 800 people, some children have developed a rare but serious complication called encephalitis.
